title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Lord of the Rings is a high fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien that follows the quest of a hobbit named Frodo Baggins to destroy a powerful ring that could bring about the end of the world.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: The Hunger Games is a dystopian novel by Suzanne Collins that takes place in a future where children are forced to compete in a televised battle to the death for the entertainment of the ruling class.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: The Da Vinci Code is a thriller novel by Dan Brown that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder and uncovers a conspiracy involving the Holy Grail.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo is a mystery novel by Stieg Larsson that follows journalist Mikael Blomkvist and computer hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a decades-old murder case.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The Alchemist is a novel by Paulo Coelho that follows the journey of a shepherd boy named Santiago as he travels to Egypt in search of treasure and discovers the true meaning of life.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: The Martian is a science fiction novel by Andy Weir that follows astronaut Mark Watney as he tries to survive on Mars afterbeing stranded there by his crew who believes he has died in a storm. Mark must use his ingenuity and resourcefulness to find a way to communicate with Earth and eventually find a way to be rescued.

author: George Orwell
description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell that depicts a totalitarian society where the government controls every aspect of citizens' lives and even their thoughts.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The Catcher in the Rye is a coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger that follows the adventures of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who has been expelled from his prep school and is struggling to find his place in the world.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy is a science fiction comedy series by Douglas Adams that follows the misadventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend as they travel through space and encounter strange beings and situations.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The Great Gatsby is a classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that explores the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age through the story of the enigmatic millionaire Jay Gatsby and his pursuit of the elusive and unattainable Daisy Buchanan.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a gothic novel by Oscar Wilde that tells the story of a young man who sells his soul to remain forever young and beautiful while his portrait ages and reflects the ugliness of his soul.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The Name of the Wind is a fantasy novel by Patrick Rothfuss that follows the story of Kvothe, a legendary hero and musician, as he recounts his life to a chronicler and relives his adventures, including his time as a student at a magical university.
